title: Spanish startup to upgrade tiny satellites to take on global IoT market
summary: Spanish startup Fossa Systems, which operates a constellation for connecting low-power monitoring devices, hopes to move pilot projects to full-blown commercial services this year by adding more capable satellites to its fleet.

title: Raytheon to develop planning software for military cargo missions that would fly on space rockets
summary: Raytheon won a $8.7 million contract to develop mission planning software for the U.S. Air Force rocket cargo program.

title: U.S. delivers first of two space sensors to be hosted on Japanese satellites
summary: The U.S. Space Force announced Jan. 17 it has delivered the first of two space sensor payloads scheduled to fly on Japan’s navigation satellites.

title: CesiumAstro acquires U.K. startup TXMission
summary: CesiumAstro, an Austin-based startup specializing in phased array technology, has acquired TXMission, a U.K. company that develops software-defined radios and modems.

title: China launch plans more than 70 launches in 2023
summary: China’s state-owned and commercial space sector actors are planning a total of more than 70 launches across 2023 as the country's space activities continue to expand.
